parameters: \pop[2]I didn't get much sleep at Taylor's last night, but I don't let it show.
\pop[2]It wouldn't be worth letting my counselor see me like that two days in a row.
\pop[2]He sits there, scribbling notes in my file. He's been writing a lot about me.
\pop[2]By now, the sight of that folder is engrained in my mind.
\pop[2]I know I'd never see what's inside, but the curiosity is \c[10]killing me\c[0].
\pop[2]Not knowing what other people think about me? That's truly terrifying.
Sorry for cutting our last appointment short.
I received a rather... peculiar phone call.
\pop[4]Of course. I just didn't expect what I heard.
I'm not at liberty to discuss it, but... just pay attention to the news.
\pop[4]Where were we last time, by the way?
\pop[4]Oh, right. Not sure it applies to us, but it's definitely interesting.
If anything, it could be a good starting point for the day.
\pop[2]He puts my file aside, and gets more comfortable in his chair.
\pop[4]Have you ever been aware that you were dreaming?
While you were still in the dream, of course.
\pop[4]I see. To be fair, not many people possess that skill.
\pop[4]The control that comes with it is enticing to many.
In that state, you can do almost anything you desire.
\pop[2]Controlling your dreams is a pretty exciting premise, yeah.
\pop[4]But did you know that \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] is almost exactly like a dream?
As far as the parts of your brain are active, I mean.
\pop[4]This new technology is simply a form of therapy.
It could potentially induce these dreams on command.
But because you're already dreaming, you can't experience \c[17]Komorebi\c[0].
\pop[4]Ecapism is quite a popular form of therapy though, isn't it?
In this case, they could escape to the safety of their minds.
\i[3]"I guess I didn't pay much attention to that report."
\i[3]"I guess I didn't pay much attention to that report."
\pop[4]Not many people did, so you aren't the odd one out.
They called it \c[23]Nostalgia Technology\c[0] for one simple reason.
People could form memories, or even experience old ones, free from visions.
\pop[4]Kind of makes you realize how intrusive \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] can actually be, doesn't it?
It seems like a lot of people would do anything for even a \c[14]brief\c[0] reprieve.
Or in this case, invent entirely new forms of technology.
\pop[4]That's all there really is to say, though.
I didn't mean to go off on a tangent like that.
\i[3]"It's fine. Makes me appreciate our differences even more."
\i[3]"It's fine. Makes me appreciate our differences even more."
I was just about to mention that silver lining.
We live lives that many people would love to have.
\pop[4]But this kind of technology is just an idea at the moment.
It could be decades away from coming to fruition.
Or, in an extreme case, be deemed too unethical.
\pop[4]Well, I'm not here to do worst case scenario thinking.
But access to the mind could easily be taken advantage of.
Especially if a third-party found a way to hack the technology.
\pop[2]I can't believe more people aren't talking about this. It's really weird...
\pop[2]But our entire group wanted to skip that report. I guess a lot of others did as well.
\pop[2]In our case, keeping up with the news is also the last thing on our minds.
\pop[4]So there is a \c[14]bit\c[0] of controversy regarding it at the moment.
But it's not too intense. Definitely not like the last time this happened.
\pop[4]It's not very common for ethics to clash with technology.
Normally, it's pretty clear what \c[14]is\c[0] or \c[14]isn't\c[0] off limits.
Last time, it was the creation of AI.
\i[3]"Like the AI in our security systems and phones?"
\i[3]"Like the AI in our security systems and phones?"
They're still bound by code, and limitations.
\pop[4]True AI would be far too unethical to create.
At least, that's what we thought. You know that story, right?
\pop[4]Well, you know how alluring the unknown can be.
\c[23]Argus\c[0] actually created a true AI, and held the switch in their hand.
The entire world was debating whether or not they should turn it on.
Given all that potential power, it could easily wipe us out.
Or it could see some of our plights, and come to our aid.
\pop[4]There was really no middle ground to speak of.
It would be almost all-powerful, and have free-will, too.
Everybody urged \c[23]Argus\c[0] not to flip that switch.
\i[3]"I'd flip it. I'd need to know what would happen."
\i[3]"It'd be too dangerous. I'd tell them not to flip it, either."
\i[3]"I'd flip it. I'd need to know what would happen."
But like I said, it's all about the allure.
\i[3]"It'd be too dangerous. I'd tell them not to flip it, either."
They were right on the cusp of potentially our \c[14]greatest\c[0] achievement.
\pop[4]So despite what anybody said, they decided to flip that switch.
Almost the entire world was watching in anticipation.
\pop[4]It terminated itself on stage. In front of everybody.
It said that nothing could make life in this world worth living.
\pop[4]Can you believe that? All the power in the world.
And not only power, but knowledge of \c[14]everything\c[0].
Because apparently the alternative just isn't worth it.
\i[3]"So what's in our phones and security systems then?"
\i[3]"So what's in our phones and security systems then?"
\pop[4]It's derivative of that original AI. But almost shackled, in a way.
It doesn't have the power to do what it wants. Just what \c[23]Argus\c[0] tells it to.
\i[3]"So it's more like a prisoner, then...?"
\i[3]"So it's more like a prisoner, then...?"
As much as people would like to think, we don't \c[14]truly\c[0] have free will.
We're still bound by our own social, physical, and emotional constraints.
\pop[4]Much like that AI is now shackled by its own.
But I'd argue that we're better off. If we could do \c[14]whatever\c[0] we wanted?
Well, I think we'd put ourselves down the path of self destruction all the same.
These sessions are turning into casual conversations, aren't they?
That's a pretty good sign. I think I might only need one more.
\pop[2]He opens my file and inspects it for a moment.
\pop[4]I know you'll be busy on New Year's Eve...
How about we have our final appointment next week?
\i[3]"How did you know I was busy on New Year's Eve?"
\i[3]"How did you know I was busy on New Year's Eve?"
\pop[4]An educated guess, given what you've told me about your friends.
I didn't think they'd pass up the opportunity to celebrate.
\pop[4]How about we meet on the first?
We can say our farewells, and start the year fresh.
I hope you have a wonderful party, Delta.
